intro: Verbascum lychnitideum, commonly known as the flameweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its leaves are fuzzy and gray-green, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Verbascum lychnitideum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
